meanings.def: to manage and organize the affairs of a company, an organization, a country, etc.
examples: the high cost of administering medical services
The pension funds are administered by commercial banks.
The charity is administered by a 20-strong management committee.
The country has to face up to the high cost of administering medical services.

meanings.def: to make sure that something is done fairly and in the correct way
examples: The questionnaire was administered by trained interviewers.
It is the function of the courts to administer the laws which Parliament has enacted.
Bishops came before the Pope and justice was administered by him in person.
The team is responsible for administering the tests and marking the papers.

meanings.def: to give or to provide something, especially in a formal way
examples: The teacher has the authority to administer punishment.
A taxi driver administered first aid to the victims.
The priest was called to administer the last rites.

meanings.def: to give drugs, medicine, etc. to somebody
examples: administer something Police believe his wife could not have administered the poison.
administer something to somebody The dose was administered to the child intravenously.

meanings.def: to kick or to hit somebody/something
examples: He administered a severe blow to his opponent's head.
